pages.page: Cooperation is indeed the key, as the BSIT students openly shared their ideas in their group discussion and successfully finished their tasks.

BSE1-3 students listen carefully to everyone’s idea as they did their small group discussion on how they will promote Filipino Language as a student as part of their activity in GNED 11- Kontekstwalisadong Komunikasyon sa Filipino
BSEM1-4 as they performed their role playing regarding the culture of the Filipinos as their final performance tasks in GNED 11 Kontekstwalisadong Komunikasyon sa Filipino

Group: Gallos, Rosario, Mirambel, Morana, Gadores, Rin, Perucho, Pante
Week 4- Framework Week 5- Outcomes Rationale and Guiding Principles Competencies and Components
• develops thinking and language through • The outcome of first principle is in line in interactive learning component 2 because we can develop our thinking and language by having interaction with other people. Example in school, a student is asking a question to the teacher and the teacher answers the student.
• develops communicative competence and • The outcome of second principle is in line in critical literacy component 3 because we develop our communicative and critical skills by allowing us to analyze the information that given to us. encourages a teacher The Example: communication in the classroom, the teacher will teach a lesson and the students will answer verbally. The output will be based on what they hear to the teacher’s teaching.
• draws on literature in order to develop • The outcome of third principle is in line in students’ understanding of their literary component 2 because learning a language heritage through text types and literary appreciation exposes learners to know their culture. Example: The teacher will assign a book review about a certain novel about their culture.
• The outcome of fourth principle is in line in • draws on informational texts and component 1 because we illustrate learning multimedia in order to build academic processes that will effect acquisition and vocabulary and strong content knowledge learning of the language. Example: The teacher will show a story book, flash cards, posters to the students for them gathered different information.
• The outcome of fifth principle is in line in • develops students’ oral language and component 1 because we need to experience interaction to develop our oral language. The literacy through appropriately challenging student can apply it in real life situation. learning Example: The teacher conducts a debate, then the student will present their stand to prove their point. This experience helps the students to gained different information while practicing their oral language.

2 K-12 CURRICULUM FRAMEWORK
• The outcome of six principles is in line in • emphasizes writing arguments, component 1 because learning tasks and explanatory/informative texts and activities will be designed for learners in such a narratives way that they will have time to reflect on and respond to ideas and information. Example: The teacher discusses their lesson about Character Education and the their will give a writing activity to the student about their insights or reflection to the lesson they discussed.
• The outcome of seven principles is in line in • provides explicit skill instruction in component 1 because learning tasks and reading and writing activities will be designed for learners to acquire the language in authentic and meaningful contexts of use. For example, lessons will be planned around learning outcomes, a theme, or a type of text to help learners use related language skills, grammatical items/structures and vocabulary appropriately in spoken and written language to suit the purpose, audience, context and culture. Learning points will be reinforced through explicit instruction and related follow-up practice.
• The outcome of eight principles is in line in • builds on the language, experiences, component 2 because language is a complex knowledge and interests that students social practice that reflects and reinforces bring to school shared understandings about appropriate actions, values, beliefs and attitudes within a community. Example: The student from the Province is entering a private school, all the students are speaking in English and the new student has different experience, interest, language and knowledge about the new environment. Of, course the student will bring his/her culture to the school he/she will enter.
• The outcome of nine principles is in line in component 4 because it measures language • nurtures students’ sense of their common proficiency in the context of specific subject ground in using language/s for matter. Assessment procedures are based on the communication as present or future global idea that various aspects of a learner’s life, both citizens to prepare them to participate in academic and personal, are integral to the school and in civic life development of language proficiency and cannot be ignored. Example: The teacher creates objectives for the students learning outcomes of the given lesson to prepare the students in participating in school or to become a future global citizen.

K-12 CURRICULUM FRAMEWORK 3
• The outcome of nine principles is in line in • assesses and reflects the students’ ability component 4 because assessment procedures to interpret and/or communicate in the are based on the notion that the interrelationships among the various aspects of target language. language, such as phonology, grammar, and
vocabulary, among others cannot be ignored. Also the four skills of language-listening, speaking, reading, and writing are seen to be parts of a structurally integrated whole. Assessment approaches should be used for communication and self-expression. Assessment also takes into account the whole learner and his or her social, academic, and physical context. Example: The teacher teaches a Chinese language lesson and then the teacher conduct a recitation. The teacher will know if the students learn a lot and reflecting about the new target language he/she teach.

Integrating Project-Based Learning into Online Learning
In class, most of the students get bored in passive learning facts and simple recitations, especially now that we transitioned from traditional face-to-face learning into online learning due to COVID-19 pandemic. With the help of Project-based learning (PBL) approach, learning can be
more interesting and effective by focusing students on work that matters. It is a form of learning that allows students to find solutions to questions that are based on real-world challenges. This
requires learners to investigate and explore significant content and learning skills to answer the driving questions. However, in this school year, how can we still make the learners engage in
projects in a digital setting? How important is it to integrate our approach into a Project-based learning?
Project-based learning approach can be a substitute for outside-the-class learning. Collaborative activities can make students have an opportunity for teamwork and stay connected
with schoolmates in a constructive way even in an online setting. In integrating PBL in online learning, we can develop the students’ 21st Century skills faster. It will not only provide a
successful learning of lessons, but also ensure learners in their future endeavors in life. Although, providing effective and engaging activities for the students can be a challenge for educators in distance learning, there are still numerous activities that they can try. Activities such as writing a
blog, recording a podcast, and creating a short documentary or video interviews can open opportunities for students to share their opinions on the projects done by their classmates.
However, despite its advantages, there are still precautions to be taken while integrating Project- based learning into online learning. Since the information is just one click away through the use
of the internet, students may become dependent on it and produce unoriginal projects. They may become a consumer of information that is available on the internet. As educators, it is our responsibility to ensure that the final product is not a research paper in disguise.
Indeed, in our current situation, one of us should be willing to compromise, not just the
educators, but also the learners. By integrating Project-based learning into online learning, teaching, and learning can be more interesting and effective. This can open opportunities for
students to grow, be creative and self-sufficient. Educators can put the students in a path that deepens their knowledge and build skills they will need in the future.

st Facilitating Problem-Based Learning in the 21 Century
Life is a series of problems to be solved. These problems come in a variety of forms such as: How do I unplug the drain in the sink? What can I do to feel more comfortable in social situations? How can we solve the energy crisis? How can we overcome the COVID-19 pandemic?
How can I get a job when I graduate? What is the best way to make literature not boring but interesting and relevant? Students’ problem-solving skills can be developed by directly teaching
them effective problem-solving strategies and then providing them with opportunities to practice these strategies.
A problem can be defined as a situation in which the present condition does not match the desired condition. Problem solving is the process of moving from the present to the desired
condition. We can help students develop their problem-solving skills by providing direct instruction of effective problem-solving strategies with opportunities to practice these strategies. One way to practice these strategies and at the same time enhance learning is to embed problems within a
curriculum. According to Duch et al (2001), Problem-Based Learning (PBL) is a student-centered approach that can be applied into any learning situation, it helps students to solve the real-world
problem. PBL also provides opportunities in working with groups, finding, and evaluating research materials, and in life-long learning. By integrating PBL into online learning we as facilitators of
learning have a wide platform where we can use it to provide different kind of assessment using technology to assess students and help them grow, learn and be successful in their chosen fields. Through problem-based learning, students are not only strengthening their skills in collaboration,
communication, and research skills, but also develop their critical thinking skills, problem-solving abilities which are essential and very useful in the field of work.
Gaining knowledge should be fun and interesting, where learners should engage themselves in a world of facts. Giving them projects and activities to is a great practice for solving
problem-based assessment especially when it is corelated to authentic problems. These activities are much better nowadays, rather than spoon feeding them everything. In applying PBL, learners go out on their own discovery and learn on their own and giving them a better understanding of
the topic. This way, students will learn to take up an initiative on their own and know more on their chosen topics.

References
Castelo, M. (2020). How to Facilitate Project-Based Learning Online. Retrieved from https://edtechmagazine.com/k12/article/2020/08/how-facilitate-project-based-learning-
online.
Problem-Based Learning (PBL). Retrieved from https://citl.illinois.edu/citl-101/teaching- learning/resources/teaching-strategies/problem-based-learning(pbl) #:~:text=Problem%2DBase
d%20Learning%20(PBL)%20is%20a%20teaching%20method%20in,presentation%20of%20fact s%20and%20concepts.

Sanaysay ukol sa paksang
Pagpapahalaga at Pagpapanatili ng Kultura ng Pilipinas
Na inihanda nina:
Barte,Carl Jhon B. Pino, Nicole
Cap-atan, Ma. Liezl Mae V.
Matalinong pagplano ating pagyabungin, Isyung panlipunan ating harapin tungo sa pagbabago.
Ang bawat bahagi ng ating kasaysayan ang bumuo sa ating kultura, ilan dito ay may mga impluwensiya ng mga banyaga. Ito rin ang nagbubuklod sa mga Pilipino. Ito rin ang nagbigay pagkakakilanlan sa ating mga Pilipino. Sa paglipas ng panahon,lumiliit na ang mundo. Ang iba’t-ibang kultura ay karaniwan na at hindi na imposible ang makipag komunikasyon sa mga taong nasa Pilipinas o ibang bansa. Ngunit, malaki ang pagkakaiba nila, dahil mayroong iba’t-ibang tradisyon, kaugalian, pananaw at yaman ang isang bansa. Marami sa kaugalian sa ating mga Pilipino ay masasabing patuloy parin na ginagawa ngayon, subalit unti-unti na ring itong kumukupas sa alaala ng mga kabataan. Sa pagdaan ng maraming pang taon, mahalagang mapanatiling buhay ito sa mga puso ng bawat Pilipino at palawakin ang kaalaman ng mga kabataan, nang sa gayon ay magpatuloy ito sa mga susunod pang henerasyon.
Aminin na natin, masakit pero totoo, na tayong mga Pilipino ay nagiging westernized o napapairal ang Colonial Mentality sa iba’t- ibang mga pamamaraan.Sa pagbili at pagtangkilik ng mga produkto, binibili ba natin ang mga produktong gawang sariling atin o yung mga stateside? Ang ating mga palabas sa telebisyon, may mga ideyang galing sa kanluran o sa ibang bansa at nilalagyan lamang ng salitang Pinoy o kaya Pilipinas para magawan ng sariling bersyon. Panay na rin ang import ng mga koreanovela, tsinovela, at anu pa mang mga nobela galing sa ibang bansa. Kahit ang mga tugtugin sa radyo at mga music channels sa ating bansa ay pinamamayagpagan ng mga banyaga. Sa social media, panay din ang paggamit natin ng salitang ingles upang magmukhang may pinag-aralan tayo, yun nga lang minsan sumasablay. Mali ang spelling, pati ang pagkakabuo ng mga pangungusap eh mali. Tunay naman na ang mga Pilipino ay isa sa mga bihasa pag dating sa paggamit ng wikang ito, pero sana ating tandaan ang sinabi ng ating pambansang bayani na ang hindi marunong magmahal sa sariling wika ay daig pa ang malansang isda. Paumanhin na rin po kung ang inyong lingkod ay hindi maiwasang gumamit din ng wikang ingles sa mga akda, sadyang may ilang mga terminolohiyang mahirap isalin sa ating sariling wika. Ito marahil ang pagkakaiba natin sa ibang mga kalapit bansa sa ating kontinente at rehiyon. Ang mga

bansang ito, hindi naman maikakaila na sila ay maunlad, sa katunayan pa nga ang ating mga kababayan ay nagpupunta sa mga bansang ito upang magtrabaho at maghanap-buhay dahil na rin sa kadahilanang mas malaki ang sweldo roon, tanda ng kaunlaran ng mga bansang ito. Ang mga bansang tinutukoy, napakalalim ng kanilang pagpapahalaga sa kanilang kultura. Ipinagmamalaki nila ang kanilang kultura at mga pamana. Ang mga antigo o ancient na mga templo at mga istruktura, kanilang binibigyang halaga at pinangangalagaan para sa mga susunod pang salinlahi, na siya pang nagiging atraksyon o mga tourist destinations. Samantalang dito sa atin, tila nilalapastangan na ang mga bantayog ng ating mga bayani. Dito na lamang sa aming lokalidad, isang lumang istruktura ang giniba upang ipatayo ang gusali ng isang paaralan. Laging may tao na nakaistambay sa labas kaya binabati nila kung sino man ang naglalakad para lang masimulan ang pakikipag-usap. Ang mga pakikipag-usap ay isang paraan para magtatag ng pagtitiwala at relasyon sa ibang tao. Iniimbitahan din ng mga tao ang mga kausap nila sa bahay nila. Sa kulturang Pilipino, pumupunta ang mga tao sa kapit-bahay nila para makakilala sila. Ang mga Filipino ay isinasama ang kanilang sarili at nakikisama bilang isang paraan ng pakikipagkaibigan. Bilang isang Filipino isa sa mga kulturang aking kinagawian o masasabi nating pinaka aking paborito ay ang mga paniniwalang ating isinasagawa tuwing bagong taon. Katulad na lamang ng Ang ingay at mga paputok ay pinapaniwalaang nakakapag-alis ng mga masasamang espiritu at mabasbasan ng sagana ang Bagong Taon at Kailangan ay buksan ang lahat ng bintana at ilaw sa pintuan para ang lahat ng grasya ay pumasok sa iyong tahanan gaya ng pagtanggap mo sa Bagong Taon. Kaunti lamang iyan sa maraming mga kultura na naging parte ng ating pagkabata na talagang humubog sa sating pagkatao.
Pilipino mayaman tayo sa kultura tulad ng pagdiriwang ng iba’t ibang pangyayari katulad ng Pasko, Pista at iba pa nkasanayan na ng pamilyang Pilipino ang mga gawaing ito naipamana na kasi ito ng mga ninuno natin ang mga nakaraaang ginagawa nila maraming mga impluwensya ang ating kultura ang kultura ng mga Pilipino ay napakahalagang bagay na dapat nating isapuso makakabuo tayo ng masaganang lipunan at magiging mainit ang relasyon ng bawat isa mapabilis ang ating komunikasyon dahil sa tayo ay nagkakaisa sa pamamagitan ng kultura nagkakaroon ng pagkakaisa isa rin sa mga nakakatulong sa pagpapaunlad ng ating bansa dahil maraming turista ang pumupunta dito sa atin para alamin ang ating kultura gusto nilang maramdaman kung gaano kahalaga ang kulturang Pilipino at makikita naman natin sa iba’t ibang pagdiriwang na maraming dayuhan ang nakibahagi sa ganung paraan kumikita din ang ating bansa napapaunlad dito ang ating literatura at nagkakaroon tayo ng saysay dahil sa ating kultura na bahagi ng bansa ngunit sa mga nag daang panahon maraming suliranin ang kinaharapng ating kultura, mula sa pananakop ng mga banyaga na nagresulta sa pagbabago na nakagisnan ng nating mga Pilipino subalit sa kabila ng mga pagbabagong ito ay atin itong napagtagumpayan at ito’y nanatili pa rin

dahil sa pamamagitan ng pag papa alala ng ating kultura ay kasabay nito ang paghahanda upang ipagdiwang at ibahagi ang mga ito sa mga kabataan at tayong lahat ay maaaring maging bahagi ng pagpapayaman ng ating kultura, maaari natin itong simulan sa ating sarili at tangkilin ang gawa ng ating mga katutubo ito ay para sa susunod pang henerasyon at para rin ito sa ating kayamanan , kayamanan ng ating bansa na maipagmamalaki sa lahat.
